page.title: 06High Melton.
page.content: The Rector of Barnburgh is also responsible for St.Jame's Church at High Melton. High Melton is a small village about a mile to the east of Barnburgh.Unlike St. Peter's Church,St. Jame's has no known legends,it has Norman features and contains numerous fragments of old stained glass.High Melton is quite a small village, and part of the population is situated on Melton Mill Lane, a little way away.The two churches organise special events.In 1984 they held Summer Flower Festivals and Mystery Plays were performed in the Barnburgh Rectory garden.There are approximately 80 to 90 houses.High Melton Hall,built in 1757 is now integrated into a modern education complex which is part of Doncaster Institute of Higher Education.
